pr_title: Download paella source code from github instead of using npm + paella update to 6.4.3

timeline.message: Download paella source code from github instead of using npm

timeline.bodyText:
@miesgre  This pull pushes the version of JQuery, and other dependencies, back for people who have already built on this version of Paella. I recommend making this pull part part of the next Paella upgrade. Then the dependencies are as current, or more current, then the  current version of the adopter's Paella dependencies.
polimediaupv/paella#533
timeline.author: karendolan

replies.bodyText:
In this PR I only change the way paella source code is downloaded
The idea is to update paella player to 6.4.2 once this PR was accepted, but I can include it in this commit if you want.
replies.author: miesgre

replies.bodyText: I prefer the Paella update to coincide with this change because the update will be associated to a snapshot with the latest dependencies. Then there would not be the chance that an upgrade Opencast would give users older Paella dependencies.
replies.author: karendolan

replies.bodyText: I updated this PR and to update paella to latest version 6.4.3 with newer dependencies (including jQuery 3.5.1)
replies.author: miesgre
